bibl.author: Ferdinand von Mueller
bibl.title: [We learn that Baron Von Mueller, while fully recognising the great honor paid him by Captain Everill, in dedicating to the baron's ¶ name a high range at the source of the Strickland and Service Rive...

encodingDesc.p: The file data/letters/1880-9/1885/85-12-04b-final.doc was converted from Microsoft Word format into TEI using an XProc pipeline.

head.supplied: [We learn that Baron Von Mueller, while fully recognising the great honor paid him by Captain Everill, in dedicating to the baron's ¶ name a high range at the source of the Strickland and Service Rive...

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Telegram not found. The text given here is from 'The last moment', Herald (Melbourne), 4 December 1885, p. 3. Alexander Macdonald was in Sydney, attending a meeting of the Geographical Society to welcome to Sydney Captain Everill, leader of the Society's New Guinea Expedition: see 'Victorian Representatives', Herald (Melbourne) 1 December 1885, p. 3, which also mentions that M had telegraphed his apologies for his 'enforced absence' from the meeting (telegram not found).

p.seg: [We learn that Baron Von Mueller, while fully recognising the great honor paid him by Captain Everill, in dedicating to the baron's

name a high range at the source of the Strickland and Service Rivers, has telegraphed to Mr A. C. M'Donald, the Hon. secretary to the Victorian Branch of the Geographical Society to-day, requesting him to solicit the gallant captain to change the name. Baron Von Mueller is desirous that the mountains shall be named the Scratchley Range

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The news that Everill had seen a range inland from the Northern Coast ranges to 'which they gave the cognomen of Baron Von Mueller' was reported in a telegram of 4 December from the Herald's reporter who had attended the reception for Everill: see 'Exploration of New Guinea', Herald (Melbourne), 4 December 1885, p. 3. What became Mt Scratchley is in the Owen Stanley Ranges, Papua New Guinea.

p.seg: in commemoration of the distinguished High Commissioner, whose recent death Baron Von Mueller so deeply deplores.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Scratchley died of malaria, at sea between Cooktown and Townsville, on 2 December 1885 (ADB).
